qas.question: In 1979, which corporation was struggling to run The Times?
What crisis in 1979 caused near ruin to The Times?
What kind of demands were causing ruin to The Times in 1979?

context: The <a0_0>Thomson Corporation<a0_0/> management were struggling to run the business due to the <a1_0>1979 Energy Crisis<a1_0/> and <a2_0>union demands<a2_0/>. Management were left with no choice but to find a buyer who was in a position to guarantee the survival of both titles, and also one who had the resources and was committed to funding the introduction of modern printing methods.
